newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Jakarta stocks seen weak, rupiah worries remain.
newsitem.headline: Jakarta stocks seen weak, rupiah worries remain.

text.p: Jakarta stocks are seen remaining weak on Friday on lingering worries following the central bank's move to scrap its intervention band and tight rupiah liquidity in the money market, brokers said.
"Sentiment would remain cautious as the rupiah is very tight. Most of our clients continue to put sell orders particularly in banking and finance stocks," one broker said.
Brokers said players were worried that the tight liquidity in the money market and the abolishment of the band would hit earnings of most companies, particularly banks and finance firms.
Indonesian overnight money jumped to 125 percent on Friday from 50.0/60.0 percent in early trade on extremely tight liquidity, dealers said.
On Thursday, the Jakarta composite index closed down 15.59 points, or 2.37 percent, at 643.01 points.
